meanings.definition: To make (a person or part of the body) more supple and flexible by stretching and exercising.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys limbering up before her dance class to prevent injuries.
meanings.sent2: Athletes often spend time limbering their muscles before a competition.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be limbering up for a big jump across the room.
meanings.sent4: His mind was limbering up with new ideas as he stretched his body.
meanings.sent5: Limbering before a workout can help improve performance and prevent strains.

meanings.definition: The action of making (a person or part of the body) more supple and flexible by stretching and exercising.
meanings.sent1: Regular limbering is important for maintaining flexibility and preventing stiffness.
meanings.sent2: The dancer's graceful movements were a result of consistent limbering.
meanings.sent3: The limbering session at the gym turned into a fun group activity.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to daily limbering paid off during the dance recital.
meanings.sent5: The benefits of limbering extend beyond physical health to mental well-being.
